questions: What is the definition of an alkane?
What is the general formula for an alkane?
What is one property of alkanes that makes them less reactive?
What is the density of alkanes compared to water?
Alkanes are unsaturated hydrocarbons with at least one double bond between carbon atoms.
What is an example of an alkane that undergoes halogenation?
answers: Alkanes are saturated hydrocarbons with only single bonds between carbon atoms.
Alkanes are generally less dense than water, meaning they will float.
Methane reacts with chlorine to form chloromethane and hydrogen chloride.
